relation: Referred to the committee on The Judiciary
Hearing scheduled for 11/13/2013 from 01:00 PM-05:00 PM in A-1
Reporting date extended to Monday June 30, 2014, pending concurrence
Accompanied a study order, see S2234
title: Actions for Bill S.646
textBeforeTable: SECTION 3. Section 62 of chapter 234A, as so appearing, is hereby amended by inserting, after the eleventh sentence, the following sentence:- These materials shall include an explanation of employer civil and criminal liability under sections 60 and 61 of this chapter. 9. Such person has served as a grand juror in any state or federal court within the previous six calendar years or the person is currently scheduled to perform such service. Any person claiming this disqualification must submit a letter or certificate from the appropriate clerk of court or jury commissioner verifying such prior or pending juror service unless such service was performed or is pending in a court of the commonwealth. SECTION 2. Section 4 of chapter 234A, as so appearing, is hereby further amended by adding the following clause:- SECTION 1. Clause (8) of section 4 of chapter 234A of the General Laws, as appearing in the 2010 Official Edition, is hereby amended by striking out the words “grand or” from the first sentence. Miscellaneous Bill History
